content: simple cable hat by sarah margaret crittenden introduction i love textured stitches and i love simple patterns that are easy to commit to physical memory my hands remember so my brain can wander here is my take on a simple crocheted cable hat i wrote this pattern to be flexible and accomodate different yarn weights and head sizes all you need is your tape measure and some very basic math skills counting and multiplication a little handmade philosophy i know there are a couple of mistakes in the hat that i made from this pattern i believe it is okay to leave a few human errors as long as it does not take away from the beauty of a piece this is proof that it is handmade leave perfection up to the machines that said i do believe the pattern as written is free from errors materials needed tape measure hook- size g 4mm yarn- heavy worsted - 1 ball 164 yds knitpicks city tweed hw measurements my hat is 6 inches 15cm across at the top rounds 1-8 and 5 inches 12 5 cm tall with the brim folded up make the top circle larger for a larger hat and smaller for a smaller hat make it as tall or short as you want by adjusting the number of cable pattern row repeats you can also adjust the length of the brim by adding or subtracting rounds gauge the gauge for my hat is 14 half_double_crochet equals 4 inches 10cm and 10 rounds equals 4 inches 10cm pattern notes this pattern is worked in the round each round is joined with a slip_stitch in the top of the first stitch the second chain of the chain 2 chain 2 counts as the first stitch of each round for example round 3 says 2hdc in each half_double_crochet so the first stitch of the round is the ch2 then half_double_crochet in the same stitch you have just made two half_double_crochet in the first stitch then move on to 2hdc in each of the next half_double_crochet stitches us terms half_double_crochet- half_double_crochet - yarn over insert hook in stitch you are working yarn over pull up a loop yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook fpt - front post treble - yarn over two times insert hook from front to back to front around the back of the post of the stitch you are working yarn over pull up a loop pull loop through two loops on hook yarn over pull loop through two loops on hook yarn over pull through remaining two loops on hook the pattern please read pattern notes before beginning 1 make magic magic_ring see donna hulka s tutorial to learn this technique magic ring tutorial or if you prefer chain 3 and join with a slip_stitch ch2 4hdc in ring join with a slip_stitch to 2nd chain of ch2 ch2 -
